intro: Tagetes mendocina, commonly known as the Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow and orange blooms. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are composed of both ray and disc florets, typical of the daisy family. Tagetes mendocina is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
